net.cabezudo.json

Class JSON

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.cabezudo.json.JSON

  • public class JSON
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides the methods to parse and create JSON objects.

    JSON class allow you to parse a string with JSON format in to a JSON tree object to be manipulated. The input may be obtained from a file on the file system. The JSON class allow you to create a JSON tree from any object and create a tree using the references to the object

    Parse

    The JSON tree obtained includes many methods to manipulate its members, such as add elements, delete elements and set new values.

    JSON tree

    The JSON tree is a tree formed by objects that extends from JSONValue, representing the JSON elements.

    There are six different types of elements in a JSON structure: JSONArray, JSONBoolean, JSONNull, JSONNumber, JSONObject, and JSONString. You can get the elements from the JSON structure navigating deep into the structure in order to reach the elements one by one.

    JSON referenced tree

    OOLV: Please explain like I'm a five years old kid A referenced JSON structure is a normal JSON structure transformed into a small structure. To do this we replace the value of a JSON object for their reference. The reference is the value of the reference field, an arbitrary field you can choose. The default field name used is id. A common example of a reference is the foreign key in a relational table.

    The easy way to get a referenced tree is using annotated objects in order to create a JSON structure. Is the easy way because if you get a JSON structure with a JSON string there isn't information about the referenced field If you create a tree from a Java normal object or creating the JSON structure using the elements object one by one, you can specify the field that going to be used to create the referenced tree with the method JSONElement.setReferenceFieldName(java.lang.String). The JSON elements has reference information.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String... args)
                 throws PropertyNotExistException

      • parse

        public static JSONValue parse(java.lang.String string)
                       throws JSONParseException
        Parse a string and create a JSON structure of objects representation of JSON elements.
        Parameters:
        string - the string used to create the JSON structure.
        Returns:
        the JSON structure.
        Throws:
        JSONParseException - if the String does not contain a parseable JSON string. The exception contains the information of the position where the parse error raise.

      • parse

        public static JSONValue parse(java.nio.file.Path filePath,
                              java.lang.String charsetName)
                       throws JSONParseException,
                              java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException,
                              java.io.IOException
        This method take the information from a file and parses it to create a JSON structure of objects representation of JSON elements.
        Parameters:
        filePath - the Path where is the file
        charsetName - The name of a supported Charset
        Returns:
        A JSON structure of objects JSONValue and JSONPair representation of the data in the string.
        Throws:
        JSONParseException - if the String does not contain a parseable JSON string. The exception contains the information of the position where the parse error raise.
        java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException - if the Character Encoding is not supported.
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs opening the file.

      • toJSONArray

        public static JSONArray toJSONArray(java.util.List<?> list)
        Convert a list of objects in a JSONArray The objects in the list must have the properties annotated with JSONProperty in order to be used as object property.
        Parameters:
        list - the list of objects to be converted.
        Returns:
        a JSONArray with a list of JSON elements.

      • toJSONObject

        public static JSONObject toJSONObject(java.lang.Object object)
        Convert a POJO in a JSONObject. The object must have the properties annotated with JSONProperty in order to be used as a object property.
        Parameters:
        object - the object to be converted.
        Returns:
        a JSONObject created using the object passed.

      • toJSONTree

        public static JSONValue toJSONTree(java.lang.Object object)
        Convert a POJO into a JSONValue. The object must have the properties annotated with JSONProperty in order to be included in the conversion. If the object is Iterable or the object is a primitive array the result is a JSONArray.
        Parameters:
        object - the object to be converted.
        Returns:
        a JSONValue created using the object passed.
